definition: a covered and curtained couch provided with shafts and used for carrying a single passenger
examples: a litter carried on the shoulders of four men

definition: a device (such as a stretcher) for carrying a sick or injured person
examples: The wounded soldier was carried to the rear by litter.

definition: material used as bedding for animals, material used to absorb the urine and feces of animals
examples: Fibrous peat was used as litter for livestock.

definition: the uppermost slightly decayed layer of organic matter on the forest floor
the offspring at one birth of a multiparous animal
trash, wastepaper, or garbage lying scattered about
examples: trying to clean up the roadside litter
a shabby writing-desk covered with a litter of yellowish dusty documents

definition: to give birth to a litter of (young)

examples: their upside-down hats littered the top of the bar

definition: to mark with objects scattered at random
to give birth to a litter
